ai.summary: Castle Ward Farm Trail is a 9.9 km moderate countryside hike in the UK, following farm tracks and rural lanes for a scenic, quiet trek through farmland.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily grassy farm tracks with hedgerows and occasional tarmac lanes. Expect gentle ascents and descents, possible mud after rain, and gates to pass through.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and daylight hours; wear sturdy, waterproof boots and layered clothing; stay on marked paths; close gates behind you; watch for livestock; carry water and snacks; bring a map or GPS; ensure your mobile is charged and share your route with someone; have a small first aid kit; be cautious of traffic on rural lanes and changing conditions.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn; winter hikes require extra care due to mud, reduced daylight, and potential icy patches.

seo.title: Castle Ward Farm Trail – 9.9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Castle Ward Farm Trail, a 9.9 km moderate hike through UK countryside. Practical tips, terrain overview, safety notes, and gear for a scenic farm track walk.
